newsitem.title: USA: System Sotware faces class action lawsuit.
newsitem.headline: System Sotware faces class action lawsuit.

text.p: A law firm representing a group of investors who hold shares in System Software Associates Inc said Wednesday it had filed a class action lawsuit against the company for allegedly misrepresenting its earnings, among other things.

Berman, DeValerio & Pease LLP said it filed the lawsuit in the U.S. District Court for the District of Illinois, Eastern Division, on January 21 on behalf of those who acquired the stock between August 22, 1994 and January 7, 1997.

It said it was charging the company and four of its officials, including Chief Executive Officer Roger Covey, with reporting revenues and earnings that were allegedly "artificially inflated," overstating the company's financial performance.

On January 7, the company announced the restatement of its fiscal 1994 and 1995 revenues and earnings, estimating that the reversal of improperly recognized revenue would aggregate more than $30 million.
Other law firms filed similiar lawsuits against the company earlier this month.
System Software has denied the charges and vowed to defend its actions.
